title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
No backlight issue all resistors on circuit are good besides R8432 which should be 150k but it's 24.2k. Also I get diode mode on PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT 0.50 which might be a shorted Cap? In the past on the same laptop I had C8471 burned but maybe happened again?

Thanks :D

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
"I get diode mode on PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT 0.50"

You can compare with the readings from similar board.

What about PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT voltage (LCD connected)?

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
"Did you try known good LCD assembly?"
Backlight adjust comes through I2C bus from T-CON board.

"Test in diode mode:
    Connect positive probe of the multimeter (red) to ground and touch the test point with black probe.
    Sometime (rarely) we need to test in reverse direction."
Lot more information on that thread...

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight

These are low readings; compare with other similar boards.
You should get OL in reverse direction.
Possibly corroded cap...

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
I replaced C8467 now i have diode mode 1.1  

The only resistor which is not showing correct value is R8432 and instead of 150k it shows 33k and diode mode on it is 0.700

R9827 is 7.4k

I replaced Q8400 also.

On Q8400 i have 5v on pin 5 and pin 18.

Pin 11 12v
pins 15,16,17 0v

Any suggestions please?

Also if someone knows if the flex cable for backlight on the lcd is broken will it still boost and give voltage on PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT.

Thanks guys

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
Depends is backlight out is shorted, or interrupted.
Getting 55V denotes no contact with LEDS strip.
0V can be short, or backlight circuit blocked for other reason.

"pins 15,16,17 0v"
So missing BKLT_EN_R; EDP_BKLT_EN too?
Check R8450-53; strange to get 0V at pins 15 & 16...

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
R8452 and  R8453 are 1.3k 

This morning i measured again and i have 3.3v on pin17, and on pins 15/16 i have 4.6v

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
R8450-53  refers to 4 resistors.
However, all seems good, if get 4.6V there now.
Still no volt at D8410 output?

Do you have image for sure?
3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD steady voltage?

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
Yes i have checked. On PPVIN_SW_LCDBKLT_SW i have 0.14 only 

R8450-53 all 4 resistors checked good

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message: PWM0 on lcd board when adjusting voltage goes up

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message: When powered on the voltage on PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT go up to 3.5v and comes back down like something is pulling it when it tries to shows backlight

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message: SOLVED!  C8462 was the issue o_O:ROFLMAO:🥳

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message:
If PWM duty cycle changes when press backlight keys, denotes the PCH works good.
The LCD assembly doesn't receive correctly this signal, or you have a problem between U8400 and LCD assembly.
Check for reaction on SCL/SDA lines at same time with PWM signal.

title: 820-00928 - A1707 - No Backlight
message: All is good now works fine C8462 had internal crack which didn't show visually and also there was no short but while I was replacing the diode and other ICs it cracked and showed I just replaced it and it worked :) Thank you very much for your help
